remarks: Two ways of expressing the unit ideal.  (Contributed by Jeff Madsen, 10-Jun-2010.)
statement:
1idl.1 $e |- G = ( 1st ` R ) $.
1idl.2 $e |- H = ( 2nd ` R ) $.
1idl.3 $e |- X = ran G $.
1idl.4 $e |- U = ( GId ` H ) $.
1idl $p |- ( ( R e. RingOps /\ I e. ( Idl ` R ) ) -> ( U e. I <-> I = X ) ) $.
